description: Set up staging environment on Railway for smoke testing before production deploys
Update StrongPrompt website to serve financial services and healthcare verticals, not just banking
Migrate remaining Vercel-hosted sites to Railway and compare CLI patterns
Implement PDF color and font changes for BFR retreat documentation
Create Railway test plan for lora_training fax OCR + hybrid search deployment
Execute local testing of lora_training PT Assistant (native Postgres + LM Studio, TKR RAG chat)
Leverage MinerU OCR library to create MD document to help LLM understand the structure of the overall document and how a specific chunk or picture fits into the document
Set up MCP database connections: global MCPs for local dev (db-local-lora, db-local-burntfork), per-project .mcp.json for Railway prod (lora_training, burntfork)
Search for old supabase references in skills files and subskills files and remove them
Standardize local Postgres database setup with username 'postgres' and password '55' across all projects and documentation

Improve postgres skill: change embedding column naming from embedding_{model} to embedding_dev/embedding_prod, use singleton table (model_settings) to hold active model and backup model configuration, update singleton.md
Verify complexity scoring and save/load behavior implementation, create combined app arch doc (user-level overview of save and checksum), delete original spec docs

Add Boolean column prefix convention to postgres skill (is_, has_, can_, should_) with domain-specific examples (healthcare, e-commerce, SaaS, finance). Singular tables (DONE). Optional: View naming guidance. Skip JSONB as non-convention.
Confirm that three fields in pt_assistant_dev.public.reports are unnecessary and can be deleted: Search Vector, Embedding Dev, and Embedding Prod

Improve header and footer recognition in fax ingestion: Add remove_footer_and_metadata() function to ingest_operative_report_v2.py to strip signature blocks, JOB#, DM/DD/DT fields preventing footer contamination in chunks. Detect patterns: Xx + signature, JOB#: \d+, DM: \w+/\w+. Test with ingest script to verify Postoperative Plan chunks are clean.

Railway CLI config strategy: ~/.railway/config.json stores project links (machine-specific, not committed). Options: (1) track expected config somewhere, (2) update project-setup skill to verify/repair railway links. Decide approach and implement.

Move pt-assistant-schema.md from global skills (~/.../postgres/pt-assistant-schema.md) to project folder. Update project-setup skill to include database schema file convention for project-specific schemas. Delete subskill and any refs.

Migrate PT assistant (local + Railway) from uuid-ossp to native gen_random_uuid(): replace uuid_generate_v4() â†’ gen_random_uuid() in schema. Bundle with PG18 upgrade for CREATE OR REPLACE TRIGGER support (idempotent migrations). Test locally first, then Railway staging.

Update pg dump skill with production-hardened guidance: (1) check ALL schema objects (tables, ENUMs, functions) before restore + DROP SCHEMA CASCADE if needed; (2) add pg_restore error handling (--clean --if-exists vs manual drop); (3) improve Railway CLI JSON extraction pattern; (4) add post-restore verification checklist (table counts, extensions, embeddings, sample query); (5) clarify extension auto-handling; (6) guide when to use direct pipe vs snapshot file

Implement LTP Roadmap Voting System: Domain-based authorization, 10 votes/month budget, vote reallocation, vote counts by item, admin domain management, voter/admin UI, FastAPI backend with transaction safety

Implement MinerU Structural Context: Add heading_level, heading_text, heading_path, parent_chunk_id, bbox columns to resource_chunk. Build heading hierarchy breadcrumbs. Map chunks to actual page_idx from MinerU JSON. Update ingestion pipeline (models, mineru_processor, chunker, database).
Update doctor office admin OTP flow to magic link instead of cut-and-paste email

Build document chunking + Qdrant semantic search agent: fixed chunking (v1) for meeting transcripts, local LM Studio embeddings, collection management strategy, integration with Claude Code (skill/slash command or standalone script)

KB improvements: (1) Change project registration to store docs path (~/repo_docs/{project}) not code repo path, update get_project_docs() accordingly; (2) Add user_notes column to calls table for appending personal observations during ingestion; (3) Update kb-ingest to prompt for user notes after processing; (4) Add kb-help subskill with CLI-style quick reference; (5) Duplicate detection for ingestion; (6) Batch summarization via LM Studio (qwen3-vl-8b-instruct-mlx)

Add kb query types beyond kb-check: kb-ask (direct questions about stakeholders), kb-recall (what did we discuss about X), kb-compare (compare stakeholder positions). Update kb SKILL.md with new subskills.

Add document type descriptions (op_notes, pre_op_consult, mri_report) to resource table with purpose and structure. Merge reports into patient_resource and patient_resource_chunk so all resource types flow through patient_resource for simplified patient-associated lookups.
Insert Mailbox services (HIPAA-compliant document routing) into provider tables. Build new 'Mega Inbox' section of PRD covering mailbox vendor integration for clinic document ingestion.

Build Bawa demo database with time-travel capability: (1) Patient journey scrubber to jump forward/backward in recovery timeline (day 1, week 3, month 4); (2) Scenario templates - frozen knee, CPM non-compliance, normal recovery; (3) Let Bawa select patient types via UI to generate demo patients; (4) Use existing Bawa TKR protocol (PostOpTKAUPDATED_09112025_HSB.pdf already in pt_assistant_dev). Goal: show prevention AND recovery handling for each scenario.

Document medical terminology in PROJECT_CONTEXT.md: (1) Document types - op notes (operative report, post-surgery details), pre-op consult/H&P (history & physical, pre-surgery baseline), face sheet (patient demographics + insurance), protocol (doctor's recovery guidelines); (2) Key terms - TKR (total knee replacement), ROM (range of motion), CPM (continuous passive motion machine), frozen knee (stiffness/limited ROM), ICD-10 (diagnosis codes); (3) Data sources - clean digital vs faxed/OCR quality issues.
